page.title: 06Dinton Hill
page.content: If you drive through Wylye Village,turn left into Teapot Lane and right towards Dinton,you will find yourself climbing the south slope of the Wylye Valley,making for the beech woods of Dinton Hill. We went in May and beneath the trees was a carpet of bluebells. We stood very still under a huge old beech,its vast bole carved with initials of the past.As we looked up, its new green leaves made a patterned umbrella against the sky.Beneath our feet were soft, moist, layers of dark leaf mold and filberts. As we listened in that soft sea of bluebells,we could hear the distant sounds of farm life;cows,sheep and tractors beyond the closer prattle of bird song.
